1{-# LANGUAGE PatternSynonyms #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Construction of lexical relmaps.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap.Construct
7  ( -- * Constructor
8    consLexmap,
9
10    -- * Constructor types
11    ConsLexmap, FindDeriv, LexmapClause,
12    -- ** Local types
13    RopParaze, ConsLexmapBody, LexmapLinkTable,
14
15    -- * Types with section number
16    SecNo, NName, NNamed,
17  ) where
18
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                 as O
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                     as B
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax                   as S
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap.Lexmap       as C
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap.LexmapTrees  as C
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data.Message             as Msg
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap.Message      as Msg
26
27import Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.TTree.Pattern
28
29
30-- ----------------------  Section number
31
32-- | Section number.
33type SecNo = Int
34
35-- | Numbered name.
36type NName = (SecNo, String)
37
38-- | Pair which key is a numbered name.
39type NNamed a = (NName, a)
40
41
42-- ----------------------  Constructor type
43
44-- | Construct lexmap.
45type ConsLexmap = [S.GlobalSlot] -> FindDeriv -> SecNo -> ConsLexmapBody
46
47-- | Find derived relmap operator.
48type FindDeriv = SecNo -> C.RopName -> [LexmapClause]
49
50-- | Source of relmap: its name, replacement, and attribute editor.
51type LexmapClause = NNamed C.LexmapTrees
52
53-- ----------------------  Local type
54
55-- | Find parameterizer for relmap operator.
56type RopParaze = C.RopName -> Maybe S.AttrParaze
57
58-- | Construct lexmap from token trees.
59type ConsLexmapBody = [S.TTree] -> B.Ab (C.Lexmap, LexmapLinkTable)
60
61-- | Lexmap and linked lexmap.
62type LexmapLinkTable = [(C.Lexmap, C.Lexmap)]
63
64
65-- ----------------------  Constructor
66
67-- | First step of constructing relmap,
68--   construct lexmap from token trees.
69--   The function returns lexmap and related lexmap links.
70consLexmap :: RopParaze -> ConsLexmap
71consLexmap paraze gslot findDeriv = lexmap 0 where
72
73    lexmap :: Int -> SecNo -> ConsLexmapBody
74    lexmap eid sec trees = result where
75        result = Msg.abLexmap trees $ case S.splitTreesBy (== "|") trees of
76                   Nothing -> single trees
77                   Just (ts, _, rest) ->
78                       baseOf "append" [S.ttreeGroup ts, S.ttreeGroup rest]
79
80        single :: ConsLexmapBody
81        single (L tok@(S.TTextRaw _ n)   : ts)
82            = find tok n ts                       -- derived or base
83        single (L tok@(S.TLocal _ _ _ _) : ts)
84            = local tok ts                        -- local relation "^/x" or "^x"
85        single [B S.BracketGroup ts]
86            = lexmap eid sec ts                   -- group "( ... )"
87        single [B _ _]
88            = Msg.reqGroup                        -- unknown group
89        single (n@(S.TermLeafName _ _ _) : ts)
90            = baseOf "add" $ n : [S.ttreeGroup ts] -- "/N E" means "add /N ( E )"
91        single []
92            = baseOf "id" []                      -- "| R | R" means "id | R | R"
93        single _
94            = Msg.unkRelmap "???"                 -- unknown relmap
95
96        -- derived or base relmap operator
97        find :: S.Token -> String -> ConsLexmapBody
98        find tok n ts = case findDeriv sec n of
99                           [src] -> deriv tok src ts
100                           []    -> base n tok ts
101                           ds    -> Msg.ambRelmap n ds
102
103        -- -----------  local, derived, or base lexmap
104
105        local :: S.Token -> ConsLexmapBody
106        local tok [] = Right (cons C.LexmapLocal tok B.def, [])
107        local _ _    = Msg.extraAttr
108
109        deriv :: S.Token -> LexmapClause -> ConsLexmapBody
110        deriv tok src ts =
111            do attr  <- S.attrPara ts
112               let lx = cons C.LexmapDerived tok attr
113               tab   <- table lx src
114               Right (lx, tab)
115
116        table :: C.Lexmap -> LexmapClause -> B.Ab LexmapLinkTable
117        table lx ((sec', _), C.LexmapTrees { C.lexmapTrees = form, C.lexmapAttrEd = edit }) =
118            Msg.abSlot [lx] $ do
119              attr2       <- S.runAttrEd edit $ C.lexAttrTree lx
120              form2       <- S.substSlot gslot attr2 form
121              (lx2, tab)  <- lexmap (eid + 1) sec' form2
122              Right $ (lx, lx2) : tab
123
124        baseOf :: C.RopName -> ConsLexmapBody
125        baseOf n = base n $ S.textToken n
126
127        base :: C.RopName -> S.Token -> ConsLexmapBody
128        base n tok ts =
129            case paraze n of
130              Nothing  -> Msg.unkRelmap n
131              Just ze  -> do para <- ze ts
132                             let lx = cons C.LexmapBase tok para
133                             submap lx
134
135        -- -----------  construct lexmap except for its submaps
136
137        cons :: C.LexmapType -> S.Token -> S.AttrPara -> C.Lexmap
138        cons ty tok para = check $ B.def { C.lexType   = ty
139                                         , C.lexToken  = tok
140                                         , C.lexAttr   = para }
141
142        check :: O.Map C.Lexmap
143        check lx | C.lexType lx == C.LexmapDerived
144                     = let n    = C.lexName lx
145                           msg  = "Same name as base relmap operator '" ++ n ++ "'"
146                       in case paraze n of
147                            Just _  -> C.lexAddMessage msg lx
148                            Nothing -> lx
149        check lx = lx
150
151        -- -----------  construct lexmaps for submaps
152
153        submap :: C.Lexmap -> B.Ab (C.Lexmap, LexmapLinkTable)
154        submap lx =
155            let mark = markLocalToken $ C.lexToken lx
156                attr = C.lexAttrTree lx
157            in case markLocalRelmap mark <$> B.filterFst S.isAttrNameRelmap attr of
158                 []     -> Right (lx, [])  -- no submaps
159                 locs   -> submap2 lx locs
160
161        submap2 :: C.Lexmap -> [(S.AttrName, [S.TTree])] -> B.Ab (C.Lexmap, LexmapLinkTable)
162        submap2 lx attr =
163            do subs <- namedLexmap `mapM` attr
164               let (sublx, tabs) = unzip subs
165                   lx'           = lx { C.lexSubmap = sublx }
166               Right (lx', concat tabs)
167
168        namedLexmap (n, ts) =
169            do (lx, tab) <- lexmap eid sec ts
170               Right ((S.attrNameCode n, lx), tab)
171
172        -- Cons up parent token when no parent or same eid.
173        markLocalToken :: S.Token -> O.Map S.Token
174        markLocalToken p (S.TLocal cp v eid' ps) | null ps || eid == eid'
175                        = S.TLocal cp v eid $ p : ps
176        markLocalToken _ loc = loc
177
178        markLocalRelmap :: O.Map S.Token -> O.Map (S.AttrName, [S.TTree])
179        markLocalRelmap mark (n@(S.AttrRelmapLocal _), ts) = (n, B.treeLeafMap mark <$> ts)
180        markLocalRelmap _ (n, ts) = (n, ts)
181
182
183-- ----------------------
184-- $ConstructionProcess
185--
186--  Construction process of lex relmaps from source trees.
187--
188--  [@\[TTree\] -> \[\[TTree\]\]@]
189--     Divide list of 'B.TTree' by vertical bar (@|@).
190--
191--  [@\[\[TTree\]\] -> \[Lexmap\]@]
192--     Construct each 'C.Lexmap' from lists of 'B.TTree'.
193--     When there are submaps in token trees,
194--     constructs 'C.Lexmap' recursively.
195--
196--  [@\[Lexmap\] -> Lexmap@]
197--     Wrap list of 'C.Lexmap' into one 'C.Lexmap'
198--     that has these relmaps in 'C.lexSubmap'.
199--
200
